author: Rasina Musallimova
title: Production at Nigerian Energy Company Aiteo's Nembe Field Resumes After Leakage Repair, Reports Say - 23.06.2024, Sputnik Africa
text: Production at Nigerian Energy Company Aiteo's Nembe Field Resumes After Leakage Repair, Reports Say [10:56 23.06.2024](/20240623/)(Updated: 10:58 23.06.2024) Subscribe Earlier in June, Dangote Refinery, Nigeria's biggest oil refinery, started exporting jet fuel to Europe as part of its strategy to grow its presence in the continental oil market. Production at the [Nigerian](https://en.sputniknews.africa/20240612/nigerias-tinubu-vows-to-continue-economic-reforms-introduce-bill-for-new-minimum-wage-1067020363.html)energy company Aiteo's Nembe field resumes after leakage repair, media reported. The leakage at the nearly 50,000 barrels per day field, located in the country's southern Bayelsa state, was reported on Monday during routine operations, the Nigerian company said. "Our dedicated team has worked diligently to address the issues caused by the recent incident and implemented enhanced safety protocols to prevent future occurrences," Aiteo was quoted as saying. Despite challenges, Nigeria's oil sector keeps developing. In early June, the Dangote Refinery, which was officially launched in May 2023, for the first time
